column4: Here is my output of lsusb and dmesg: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/46346/
This is all done while my windows mobile device is connected... Why doesnt it show up?
thanks for helping out
it's a timing problem. Try connecting the device repeatedly until you don't get the read/64 error.

how shall i see if i get a read error? with dmesg? And just connect/unconnect a lot of times? I've allready done that. And it all started with VMWare interfaring with my USB device... is there anyway to undo what VMWare may have done?
the read/64 errors are in dmesg output, but should be logged to /var/log/syslog as well
and you are right its a hardware problem. I allways used to see the windows mobile device as a wired network in nm-applet
I doubt that vmware has done it to your device. Do try a reset on it, though
I'm guessing vmware did this to my USB port...? I've tried a reset and reconnecting doent help. I still get read errors.
are you running Ubuntu as a vmware guest?
Ubuntu is host. XP is guest. But right now it won't even connect to host
Ubuntu is host. XP is guest. But right now it won't even connect to host through usb port
does Windows see any of it when you connect the ppc while Windows has focus?
no. and the usb device option in VM menu shows no device to connect
I have tried using virtualbox to. It shows my logitech mouse when connected but no ppc
I don't know what to suggest, other than trying to connect it to a Windows host
ok. but its my ubuntu usb device which has problems now... well. thanks anyway for your help
you mean you have trouble with other USB devices as well?
not that i know of yet
what do you mean by "Ubuntu USB device" then?
I thought so... but its maybe just my ppc... My wrong :)
